info.name: EPM RestAPI
info.description:
In this topic:

  • SDK Supported Platforms
  • Using the EPM Web Services SDK
  • Return Codes
  • API Versioning
  • API Limitations

The main purpose of the EPM Web Services is to automate tasks that are usually performed manually using the UI.

SDK Supported Platforms

The EPM Web Services SDK is a RESTful API that can be invoked by any RESTful client for various programming and scripting environments, including Java, C#, Perl, PHP, Python and Ruby.

Using the EPM Web Services SDK

The EPM Web Services SDK enables you to perform activities on EPM objects via a REST Web Service interface. Each EPM object has its own URL path in the EPM website that can be accessed using the relevant HTTP/S request verb.

 

Although you can use HTTP requests, for security reasons it is recommended to use HTTPS.

If you use the APIs only to retrieve data, for security reasons it is recommended to create a user with read-only permissions and log in with this user to run the APIs.

Return Codes

The following table lists all the return codes that are returned from the REST Web Services API.

Return Code

Code Number

Description

Success

200

The request succeeded. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request, the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

Created

201

The request was fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

Accepted

202

The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

No Content

204

The server successfully processed the request and is not returning any content (no response body). This code is typically returned by DELETE requests.

Bad request

400

The request could not be understood by the server due to incorrect syntax.

Unauthorized

401
  • The request requires user authentication.
  • Your session has expired and your user has been disconnected

Forbidden

403
  • The request was valid, but the server is refusing action. The user might not have the necessary permissions for the action.
  • The request was valid, but the usage limit according to the license was reached.

Not Found

404

The requested resource could not be found, or the user does not have permissions for this resource.

Method Not Allowed

405

A request method is not supported for the requested resource.

Request Timeout

408

The request was received by the server, but there was a timeout reaching one of the next components.

Conflict

409

The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

Internal Server Error

500

The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

API Versioning

This topic explains how to specify which REST API version you intend to implement.

By default, all called REST APIs are the latest version. You can manually change the version of the selected API by specifying the version to implement in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/10.7.0.1/Sets/<setId>/Events/<Category>

 

 

Best practice: We recommend not specifying the version number in the REST API URL, which will run the latest version of the API. Review the EPM Release Notes to determine which APIs have changed each release.

API Limitations

In this topic:

  • Limit the API calls in a set period of time
  • Limit the concurrent login sessions

Limit the API calls in a set period of time

The Maximum API calls Server Configuration parameter limits the number of API calls a user can make in the API call time period (Minutes).

The API call time period (Minutes) Server Configuration parameter defines the time period when no more than the Maximum API calls are allowed.

For details, refer to Set Advanced Server Configurations. These parameters can be configured by on-premise customers.

Limit the concurrent login sessions

Only one login per minute per user is allowed using the API.

item.name: Get EPM Version
item.description:
In this topic:

  • URL
  • Resource information
  • URL parameters
  • Output

This method enables the user to retrieve the EPM version.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Server/Version

Resource information

HTTP method

GET

URL parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

EPM_Server

String

EPM Server

For SaaS users - EPM dispatcher server name

For on-premise users - EPM server name

Yes

Version

String

API version

Default value - Latest version

Format is x.x.x.x (for example, 10.7.0.1)

No

Output

Parameter

Type

Description

Version

String

The EPM version
{
"Version": "string" 
}

request.description:
Windows authentication

In this topic:

  • URL
  • Resource information
  • URL parameters
  • Header parameter
  • Body parameter
  • Output

This method authenticates a user to EPM by Windows authentication and returns a token that can be used in subsequent web services calls.

After the configured timeout expires, users have to log on again using their username and password.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Auth/Windows/Logon

Resource information

HTTP method

POST

URL parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

EPM_Server

String

EPM Server

For SaaS users - EPM dispatcher server name

For on-premise users - EPM server name

Yes

Version

String

API version

Default value - Latest version

Format is x.x.x.x (for example, 10.7.0.1)

No

Header parameter

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

Content-Type

String

Content type

application/json

Yes

Body parameter

Parameter

Type

Description

Mandatory

Application ID

String

Source application ID, to distinguish between REST API calls from EPM and REST API calls from another application

Yes

 

  {
"ApplicationID": "string" 
}

Output

Parameter

Type

Description

EPMAuthenticationResult

String

Session token that identifies the session, encoded in BASE 64

 

  {
"EPMAuthenticationResult": "string" 
}

EPM authentication

In this topic:

  • URL
  • Resource information
  • URL parameters
  • Header parameter
  • Body parameters
  • Output

 

This method authenticates a user to EPM using username and password and returns a token that can be used in subsequent Rest API calls.

After the configured timeout expires, users have to log on again using their username and password.

The session timeout for all APIs is part of the session token and is defined by the Timeout for inactive session Server Configuration parameter.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Auth/EPM/Logon

Resource information

item.name: Get Sets list
item.description:
In this topic:

  • URL
  • Resource information
  • URL parameters
  • Header parameters
  • Output
This method enables the user to retrieve the list of Sets.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Sets

Resource information

HTTP method

GET

URL parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

EPM_Server

String

EPM Server

EPM Server name

(not dispatcher server name)

Yes

Version

String

API version

Default value - Latest version

Format is x.x.x.x (for example, 10.7.0.1)

No

Offset

Number

Number of sets to skip

Default value - 0

No

Limit

Number

Maximum number of sets to return

(up to 1000)

Default value - 50

No

Header parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

Authorization

String

Token generated in the EPM authentication API

use basic <Token>

Yes

VFUser

String

Token generated in the Windows authentication API

use <Token>

Yes

Output

Parameter

Type

Description

SetsCount

Number

Total number of sets

Each Set returns the following information:

SetId

String

Set ID

SetName

String

Set name

SetDescription

String

Set description

IsNPVDI

Boolean

Indicates whether the Set is an NPVDI Set

 

  { 
  "SetsCount": number, 
  "Sets": [ 
   { 
    "Id": "string", 
    "Name": "string", 
    "Description": "string", 
    "IsNPVDI": boolean 
   } 
  ] 
}

item.name: Get aggregated events
Aggregated events - Inbox from specific dates
Aggregated events - ThreatDetection from specific dates
Aggregated events - PolicyAudit from specific dates
Aggregated events - PolicyAudit  -  date and policy name

item.description:
In this topic:

  • URL
  • Resource information
  • URL parameters
  • Header parameters
  • Query parameters
  • Event Type
  • Output

 

This method enables the user to retrieve aggregated events from EPM according to a predefined filter.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Sets/<setId>/Events/<Category>

Resource information

HTTP method

GET

URL parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

EPM_Server

String

EPM Server

EPM Server name

(not dispatcher server name)

Yes

Version

String

API version

Default value - Latest version

Format is x.x.x.x (for example, 10.7.0.1)

No

SetID

String

ID of a set that the user has permission to view, generated in the Get Sets list API

 

Yes

Category

String

Event category
  • ApplicationEvents
  • PolicyAudit
  • ThreatDetection

Yes

Header parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

Authorization

String

Token generated in the EPM authentication API

use basic <Token>

Yes

VFUser

String

Token generated in the Windows authentication API

use <Token>

Yes

Query parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

Offset

Number

Number of events to skip

Default value - 0

No

Limit

Number

Maximum number of events to return (up to 100)

 

No

EventType

String

Event type

Value with All or with a list of event types separated by commas

For the list of event types, see the Event Type table

All

No

Publisher

String

Digital signature of the application that triggered the event (if applicable)

Wildcards and unsigned are supported

Wildcards:

  • "xxx xxx" - filters the exact value between the quotes
  • xxx xxx - filters anything that contains the string
  • *xxx xxx* - filters anything that contains the string between the *
  • xxx* - filters all strings that start with the value before the *
  • *xxx - filters all strings that end with the value after the *

No

DateFrom

Date

Only show events since the given date

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

If DateFrom and DateTo are not valued, only events from the last day are returned

No

DateTo

Date

Only show events until the given date

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

If DateFrom and DateTo are not valued, only events from the last day are returned

No

Justification

String

Determines if the event has justification details

Not relevant for ThreatDetection

Default value: All

Valid values: All, WithJustification

No

ApplicationType

String

Type of application that triggers the event

Value with All or with a list of application types separated by commas:

Not relevant for ThreatDetection

Default value: All

Valid application types: Executable, Script, MSI, MSU, ActiveX, Com, Win8App, DLL, DMG (for PolicyAudit only), PKG (for PolicyAudit only)

No

PolicyName

String

Name of the policy that triggers the event

Wildcards are supported

Not relevant for ApplicationEvents

Wildcards:

  • "xxx xxx" - filters the exact value between the quotes
  • xxx xxx - filters anything that contains the string
  • *xxx xxx* - filters anything that contains the string between the *
  • xxx* - filters all strings that start with the value before the *
  • *xxx - filters all strings that end with the value after the *

No

Event Type

Category

Event Type

ThreatDetection
  • Attack
  • SuspiciousActivity

ApplicationEvents
  • ElevationRequest
  • Trust
  • Installation
  • Launch
  • ManualRequest
  • Block
  • Access
  • Ransomware

PolicyAudit
  • Trust
  • Installation
  • Launch
  • Block
  • Access
  • StartElevated
  • Computer

Output

Parameter

Type

Description

Category

TotalCount

Number

The total number of retrieved events per category

All

FilteredCount

Number

The number of retrieved events per category that matches the required filter

All

FileQualifier

String

Unique file identifier

All

EventName

String

Event display name

All

Hash

String

SHA1 of the application that triggered the event

All

Publisher

String

Digital signature of the application that triggered the event (if applicable)

All

TotalEvents

Number

Number of events in the given time period

All

ApplicationType

String

Type of application that triggers the event

Valid application types: Executable, Script, MSI, MSU, ActiveX, Com, Win8App, DLL, DMG (for PolicyAudit only), PKG (for PolicyAudit only)
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

EventType

String

Event type

For the list of event types, see the Event Type table

All

LastEventSourceType

String

Origin type where the file that triggered the last event was acquired

Valid values:

  • Unknown
  • OldApplication
  • Internet
  • Updater
  • NetworkShare
  • RemovableDrive
  • CDRom
  • Windows
  • LocalDisk
  • EPM
  • LocalShare
  • Email
  • DeveloperApp
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

LastEventSourceName

String

Point of origin where the file that triggered the last event was acquired
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

LastEventPreHistorySourceType

 String

Source type of the origin where the file that triggered the last event was acquired

Valid values:

  • Unknown
  • OldApplication
  • Internet
  • Updater
  • NetworkShare
  • RemovableDrive
  • CDRom
  • Windows
  • LocalDisk
  • EPM
  • LocalShare
  • Email
  • DeveloperApp
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

LastEventPreHistorySourceName

 String

Source of the origin where the file that triggered the last event was acquired
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

LastEventPackageName

 String

Installation package or executable that created the file that triggered the last event
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

LastEventDate

Date

Last Event Date

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

All

LastEventUserName

String

User who triggered the last event

Not available for Threat Detection events

All

LastEventComputer

String

Computer where the last event was triggered

Not available for Threat Detection events

All

LastEventID

String

Unique event identifier

Not available for Threat Detection events

All

PolicyName

String

Policy that triggered the event
  • PolicyAudit
  • ThreatDetection

IsMalware

Boolean

Indicates whether the file is malware, according to the VirusTotal check
  • PolicyAudit
  • ApplicationEvents

ThreatDetectionAction

String

Block or Detect action taken by EPM when the event occurred

 ThreatDetection

FileName

String

Name of the file that triggered the event

 ThreatDetection

AffectedComputers

Number

Number of computers affected by the event

 ThreatDetection

AffectedUsers

Number

Number of users affected by the event

Not available for Threat Detection events

 ThreatDetection

ExposedUsers

Number

Number of exposed users affected by the event

 ThreatDetection

 

  { 
 "Events": [ 
  { 
    "TotalEvents": number, 
    "FileQualifier": "string", 
    "EventType": "string", 
    "EventName": "string", 
    "ApplicationType": "string", 
    "Hash": "string", 
    "Publisher": "string", 
    "LastEventSourceType": "string", 
    "LastEventSourceName": "string", 
    "LastEventPreHistorySourceType": "string", 
    "LastEventPreHistorySourceName": "string", 
    "LastEventPackageName": "string", 
    "LastEventDate": "date/time", 
    "LastEventUserName": "string", 
    "LastEventComputer": "string", 
    "IsMalware": boolean, 
    "LastEventID": "string" 
  } 
 ], 
 "TotalCount": number, 
 "FilteredCount": number 
}

item.name: Get raw events
item.description:
In this topic:

  • URL
  • Resource information
  • URL parameters
  • Header parameters
  • Query parameters
  • Event Type
  • Output


This method enables the user to retrieve raw events from EPM according to a predefined filter.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Sets/<setId>/Events/<Category>/<FileQualifier>

Resource information

HTTP method

GET

URL parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

EPM_Server

String

EPM Server

EPM Server name

(not dispatcher server name)

Yes

Version

String

API version

Default value - Latest version

Format is x.x.x.x (for example, 10.7.0.1)

No

SetID

String

ID of a set that the user has permission to view, generated in the Get Sets list API

 

Yes

Category

String

Event category
  • ApplicationEvents
  • PolicyAudit
  • ThreatDetection

Yes

FileQualifier

String

Unique file ID generated in the Get aggregated events API

 

Yes

Header parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

Authorization

String

Token generated in the EPM authentication API

use basic <Token>

Yes

VFUser

String

Token generated in the Windows authentication API

use <Token>

Yes

Query parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

Offset

Number

Number of events to skip

Default value - 0

No

Limit

Number

Maximum number of events to return (up to 100)

 

No

EventType

String

Event type

Value with All or with a list of event types separated by commas

For the list of event types, see the Event Type table

All

No

DateFrom

Date

Only show events since the given date

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

If DateFrom and DateTo are not valued, only events from the last day are returned

No

DateTo

Date

Only show events until the given date

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

If DateFrom and DateTo are not valued, only events from the last day are returned

No

Justification

String

Determines if the event has justification details

Not relevant for ThreatDetection

Default value: All

Valid values: All, WithJustification

No

PolicyName

String

Name of the policy that triggers the event

Wildcards are supported

Not relevant for ApplicationEvents

Wildcards:

  • "xxx xxx" - filters the exact value between the quotes
  • xxx xxx - filters anything that contains the string
  • *xxx xxx* - filters anything that contains the string between the *
  • xxx* - filters all strings that start with the value before the *
  • *xxx - filters all strings that end with the value after the *

No

Event Type

Category

Event Type

ThreatDetection
  • Attack
  • SuspiciousActivity

ApplicationEvents
  • ElevationRequest
  • Trust
  • Installation
  • Launch
  • ManualRequest
  • Block
  • Access

PolicyAudit
  • Trust
  • Installation
  • Launch

  • Access
  • StartElevated
  • Computer

Output

Parameter

Type

Description

TotalCount

Number

The total number of retrieved events per category

FilteredCount

Number

The number of retrieved events per category that matches the required filter

EventID

String

Unique event identifier

Computer

String

Computer where the event was triggered

User

String

User who triggered the event

IsUserAdmin

Boolean

If the user who triggered the event is a local administrator

TimeFirst

DateTime

First time the event was triggered. If AgentEventCount =1, TimeFirst will be identical to TimeLast

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

TimeLast

DateTime

Last time the event was triggered. If AgentEventCount =1, TimeFirst will be identical to TimeLast

ISO-8601 to format dates and UTC time zone - YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

EventType

String

Event type

For the list of event types, see the Event Type table

AgentEventCount

Number

Number of times the event was triggered

Justification

String

SourceType

 String

Valid values:

  • Unknown
  • OldApplication
  • Internet
  • Updater
  • NetworkShare
  • RemovableDrive
  • CDRom
  • Windows
  • LocalDisk
  • EPM
  • LocalShare
  • Email
  • DeveloperApp

 String

Source of the origin where the file that triggered the last event was acquired

 String

If the restrict event action is allow or restrict

Relevant for Restrict events only

AccessTargetType

String

Type of the accessed resource

Relevant for Restrict events only

Valid values:

  • Registry
  • File
  • ProcessMemory
  • NetworkShare
  • Internet
  • Intranet

AccessTargetName

String

Name of the accessed resource

PolicyName

String

Policy that triggered the event

ThreatDetectionAction

String

Block or Detect action taken by EPM when the event occurred

This method enables the user to retrieve raw events file data from EPM according to a predefined filter.

URL

Make sure there are no spaces in the URL.

 

https://<EPM_Server>/EPM/API/<Version>/Sets/<setId>/Events/<Category>/Raw/<EventID>

Resource information

HTTP method

GET

URL parameters

Parameter

Type

Description

Values

Mandatory

EPM_Server

String

EPM Server

EPM Server name

(not dispatcher server name)

Yes

Version

String

API version

Default value - Latest version

Format is x.x.x.x (for example, 10.7.0.1)

No

SetID

String

ID of a set that the user has permission to view, generated in the Get Sets list API

 

Yes

String

Event category
  • ApplicationEvents

Yes
